Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Gageotetrin A (natural AMPs; nonribosomal peptide; lipopeptides;  marine bacteria, prokaryote; XXL)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification: The N-terminal C14 fatty acid is a 3-hydroxy-11-methyltridecanoic acid (HTDA).Activity: It is more active against fungi compared to bacteria with MIC values of 0.02-0.04 uM. Inhibited S. aureus (MIC 0.03 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 0.03 uM), S. typhi (MIC 0.06 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.06 uM), R. solani (MIC 0.06 uM), C. acutatum (MIC 0.03 uM), B. cinera (MIC 0.03 uM).Toxicity: not toxic to numerous human cancer cells at 30 ug/ml. Corrected 5/2016; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Tareq FS, Lee MA, Lee HS, Lee YJ, Lee JS, Hasan CM, Islam MT, Shin HJ.2014
Literature Information.Title: Gageotetrins A-C, noncytotoxic antimicrobial linear lipopeptides from a marine bacterium Bacillus subtilis.
